comment: Real easy class but it was 90% busy work tbh. It sort of relates to senior design but I could've learned all of this in 2-3 weeks myself rather then 15 presentations over a semester and loads of busy work. He is also very forgiving on grades. Will let you resubmit until you get a 90+ on the assignment. Also cares about his students alot!

This class was easy. We made a lot of powerpoints that reviews articles of the design system your group chose for a senior project idea. Very picky on what he wants in the slide, must be in a template he provides, likes pictures and graphs and good citations. If you made a mistake, email him and he'll allow you to fix it. Lectures are unorganized.
Made us write a 500 word paper on a black dot on the back of a page. 500 words on a dot. I am in the class for engineering ethics not creative writing.
great

comment: Huge fan of Professor Okhio. No doubt one of the beat professors to be around, spends a lot of class preparing you for the FE and your career. He genuinely cares about the success of his students and as long as you put in the effort he's always willing to meet you in the middle. 10/10 would recommend.

Its true, he is unorganized, gives wacky feedback and is overall hard to understand. Sometimes it feels like he's speaking in riddles. However, he is an amazing resource to have as an engineer student. Get on his good side and he will write you a glowing recommendation letter,  free resources for the FE exam and even job opportunities!

The best advice I can give if you are an Engineer at KSU is to get to know Okhio. He is a nice guy and pretty flexible on due dates if he knows you are trying. He is a wonderful resource and wants all of his students to succeed. A's and B's come easy. Yes, he has a few quirks and can be a bit hard to understand, but will clear the air if you ask!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He turned my side project into a directed study. I was all up for it until the started to make the class into the things it was never supposed to be. He made me hate my side project and have endless sleepless nights due to his unclear communication for the deliverables. Also Saturday email 2 days before the grades are due 3 more tasks to complete.

He was not the worst professor I have taken. But he is unorganized, uses unclear instructions and explain the task in an unclear way, no grade organization to the point where you might have all 90s% and still question if you made an A in the class. If you can take the class with someone else for the love of all that is holy.

Professor Okhio states the first day of the class that this is an easy A+. He understands the class is an one hour credit class and is not trying to fail someone in a one credit hour class. It is a lot of group work but it is easy group work and the test are very easy.

Okhio is by far the worst professor I have ever had at KSU, He has no level of organization, he grades on the most arbitrary random scale possible, and you get no useful feedback on any assignments. He is an easy A, but you will not learn anything with him and will come out of the class likely hating the class

I expect him to not be teaching capstone courses much longer. Not well suited for the job in my opinion. As you notice.. different professors are starting to teach these courses. Hmmm, I wonder why. Probably because Okhio is bad at them and a class as important as the capstone needs someone very diligent. Okhio is a nice dude though.

I could not take this class very seriously. Cyril is generally very open to saying he will help you, and often talk with you one-on-one if you schedule, however his "advice" has NEVER been clear and very open-ended with no clear expectations. Sometimes I even thought he was just rambling about general topics instead of our specific topic...

It seems like Cyril Okhio puts in very little work in class. Things are not explained well, he sometimes pokes fun at people asking question, and the course outline on D2L is just thrown together with tons of stuff from every past semester. Maybe he does more we don't know about? If not, I don't understand how he makes 100k/yr
NEVER clearly explained expectations and then would criticize and humiliate those who didn't understand, answered something wrong or misunderstood what he meant.

Dr. Okhio is very quite and you cannot understand what he is saying most of the time. However, he gives take home tests and makes you present on certain topics. He understands its a 1 credit hour class and makes it an easy A. You do not need the book because he provides the online version.

Okhio's class isn't difficult: you need to put in some effort, but I would rarely call it "hard" work. He'll review different topics for the FE exam and occasionally bring in speakers . You'll also present some of the FE topics in groups. Be sure he knows who you are and that you participate by showing up for class and speaking/asking questions.
Very effective and smart Professor.I highly recommend him.

Horrible professor. Expects you to already know a lot even though it's an introductory class once a week and one credit hour filled with freshmen. Work load is huge and tedious. Had us BUY and build a ridiculous robot made out of STRAWS with extremely unclear instructions. Had to do a presentation as the final. Don't bother asking questions either.
